{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the symptoms described (headache, nausea, tenderness in temporal region), along with the mention of migraine, the most likely diagnosis is giant cell arteritis. Giant cell arteritis is an inflammatory condition that affects the blood vessels, particularly the temporal arteries. It commonly presents with headache, scalp tenderness, and visual disturbances. On microscopic investigation, the characteristic finding in giant cell arteritis is granulomatous giant cell lesions. These lesions consist of multinucleated giant cells surrounded by lymphocytes and macrophages. Therefore, the answer choice is C. Granulomatous giant cell lesions.", "answer_choice": "C"}
